result.execSummary:
The defendant Sarahlee R. Merriam was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Reckless Injury [Modifiers: Repeater, Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Domestic Abuse], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.23(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Clerk: Britney
Case Called: 2:20 p.m. 
State appears by ADA Michael Puerner. Defendant appears in custody with Attorney Robert Gardner. Date & time set for Sentencing Hearing. PSI completed and reviewed by all parties. No corrections to be made, however, Attorney Gardner clarifies a few statements. Victim, K.K. addresses court. State recites recommendation. State offers Ex.1- Photo #1, Ex.2- Photo #2, Ex.3- Photo #3 & Ex.4- Photo #4. COURT receives Ex.1-4. Attorney Gardner makes arguments. Defendant recites apology to victim and addresses COURT. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT ORDERS: Ct.1- 7 years WI State Prison System, 3 years IC & 4 years ES. CONDITIONS of ES: Participate in any assessment, counseling & treatment as deemed appropriate by agent, maintain absolute sobriety, GFE obtain/maintain FTE, schooling or a combination of both, CC, DNA sample & surcharge, DA surcharge, pay restitution in the amount of $40,296.91, pay restitution to M.O. in the amount of $1,755.55 (hearing to be set once released from custody)
Defendant is entitled to 441 days credit. Defendant is not eligible for CIP/SAP at this time. 
Adj: 3:19 p.m.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 3, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Clerk: Britney

Attorney Gardner states he just received the PSI yesterday and is requesting adjournment of Sentencing Hearing to allow time for defendant and counsel to review PSI. 
COURT GRANTS adjournment. 
Parties to set date with JA on 04/13 or CC- 04/14/15 at 1:00 p.m. in Br.2 office. Only 1 hour needed.
